Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "Battler-san returned to the guesthouse at 3:00 AM. Then, the rest of you split up about 30 minutes later, right?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Battler‐san returned to the guesthouse at {nobr:3 a.m.} Then, the rest of you split up about thirty minutes later, is that correct?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Battler-san returned to the guesthouse at 3:00 AM. Then, the rest of you split up about 30 minutes later, right?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「午前３時に戦人さんがゲストハウスに戻られて。その後、３０分くらいで皆さんも解散されたんですね？」
Russian (RU): "Баттлер вернулся в домик для гостей в {nobr:три часа ночи}. А потом, спустя полчаса, разошлись и вы, так?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O Battler‐san retornou para casa de hóspedes às {nobr:3 a.m.} Então, os que sobraram se dividiram cerca de trinta minutos depois, correto?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「午夜 3 點，戰人回了賓館。然後，在 30 分左右，諸位也解散了？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「午夜 3 点，战人回了宾馆。然后，在 30 分左右，诸位也解散了？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Battler-san è ritornato alla casa degli ospiti alle 3:00. Quindi, il resto di voi si è diviso circa 30 minuti dopo, giusto?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Steam (ST): "Yes, that's right. Drowsiness was finally starting to catch up to us. We decided to take a short rest and then start up again."
Umineko Project (UP): "Yes, that's right. We were getting pretty tired by that point. We decided to take a short rest before starting up again."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Yes, that's right. We did get fairly tired. We decided to take a short rest and then start up again."
PC Japanese (JP): 「えぇ、そうよ。いい加減、眠くなってきて。一眠りしてから仕切り直そうってことになったのよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「えぇ、そうよ。いい加減、眠くなってきて。一眠りしてから仕切り直そうってことになったのよ」
Russian (RU): "Да, верно. Мы совсем вымотались. Решили сделать короткий перерыв, а затем начать снова."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim, isso mesmo. Nós já estávamos bem cansados naquela hora. Decidimos fazer uma pausa para descansarmos antes de recomeçar."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是啊，沒錯。因為實在熬不住睡意了。所以我們決定了，睡一覺後再重新來過喲。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是啊，没错。因为实在熬不住睡意了。所以我们决定了，睡一觉后再重新来过哟。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sì, è vero. Ci eravamo stancati abbastanza. Avevamo deciso di fare una piccola pausa e dopo ricominciare."

Steam (ST): To smoke out the murderer of the first twilight, Erika closely questioned everyone involved to check their alibis and evidence.
Umineko Project (UP): To smoke out the murderer of the first twilight, Erika closely questioned everyone involved to check their alibis and evidence.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ヱリカは、第一の晩の殺人犯を炙り出すため、関係者全員に細かく聞き込んでは、そのアリバイや証拠が存在しないか、確かめていた。
Russian (RU): Чтобы выкурить убийцу первых сумерек, Эрика допрашивала всех, проверяя их алиби и доказательства.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para expor o assassino do primeiro crepúsculo, Erika questionou todos os envolvidos para verificar se tinham álibis e buscar por evidências.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪梨花為了查出第一晚的殺人犯，向所有有關人員細致地聽取了口供，查證著他們的不在場證明及證據。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘梨花为了查出第一晚的杀人犯，向所有有关人员细致地听取了口供，查证着他们的不在场证明及证据。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per scoprire l'omicidio del primo crepuscolo, Erika interrogò attentamente tutti i coinvolti per controllare i loro alibi e le loro prove.

Steam (ST): To confirm these, she went around the mansion with them, and when needed, took several trips out to the guesthouse through all the rain.
Umineko Project (UP): To confirm these, she went around the mansion with them, and when needed, took several trips out to the guesthouse through all the rain.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): To confirm these, she went around the mansion with them, and when needed, took several trips out to the guesthouse through all the rain.
PC Japanese (JP): それを確認するために、屋敷中に同行させ、必要ならこの雨の中を、何度もゲストハウスに往復するのだった。
Russian (RU): Для их подтверждения она обошла с ними особняк и при необходимости несколько раз шла под дождём в гостевой домик.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para confirmar, ela saiu pela mansão com eles, e quando necessário, fazendo diversas viagens à casa de hóspedes, debaixo da chuva.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 為查證這個不在場證明，她會帶人在宅邸裡試演，有必要的話，還會在這大雨中，在大屋與賓館間往返個好幾次。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 为查证这个不在场证明，她会带人在宅邸里试演，有必要的话，还会在这大雨中，在大屋与宾馆间往返个好几次。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per confermarli, andò in giro per la villa con loro, e quando necessario, fece varie gite fuori alla casa degli ospiti attraverso tutta la pioggia.

Steam (ST): ...Her vitality was impressive.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Her vitality was admirable.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……這份旺盛活力，令人佩服。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……这份旺盛活力，令人佩服。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... La sua vitalità era ammirevole.

Steam (ST): ...Though she was an uninvited guest, everyone had long since stopped feeling anything strange about the way she played the detective...
Umineko Project (UP): ......Though she was an uninvited guest, everyone had long since stopped feeling anything strange about the way she imitated a detective...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……招かざる客人のはずの彼女が、探偵の真似事をすることに、とっくに一同は違和感を覚えなくなっていた…。
Russian (RU): ......Хотя она незваная гостья, никому уже давно не казалось странным её подражание детективу...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Embora fosse uma convidada indesejada, logo todos deixaram de sentir qualquer coisa de estranho na forma em como ela imitava um detetive...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……而對於明明是不速之客，卻又在學偵探樣地折騰人一事，眾人早就不感到別扭了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……而对于明明是不速之客，却又在学侦探样地折腾人一事，众人早就不感到别扭了…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Anche se era un ospite non invitato, tutti avevano smesso da lungo tempo di sentire qualcosa di strano sul modo in cui imitava un detective...

Speaker: Ronove
Steam (ST): "...It seems Erika is also steadily building her foundation."
Umineko Project (UP): "......It seems Erika is also steadily building her foundation."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……ヱリカも、着実に、基礎を固めているようですな」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Parece que Erika foi construindo sua base de forma sólida."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……繪梨花倒也是在扎扎實實地穩固基盤呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……绘梨花倒也是在扎扎实实地稳固基盘呢。」

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "It's useless. Whether alibis exist or not, she can't deny our existence. ...Kinzo escaped through the window and is now one with the mists of Rokkenjima. She most certainly won't be able to capture or deny him."
Umineko Project (UP): "It's useless. Whether alibis exist or not, she can't deny our existence. ......Kinzo escaped through the window and is now one with the mists of Rokkenjima. She can never capture or deny him."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "It's useless. Whether alibis exist or not, she can't deny our existence. ......Kinzo escaped through the window and is now one with the mists of Rokkenjima. She most certainly won't be able to capture or deny him."
PC Japanese (JP): 「無駄なことよ。アリバイがあろうとなかろうと、妾たちの存在を否定することなど出来ぬわ。……金蔵は窓より逃れ、今や六軒島の霞よ。決して捕らえることも、否定することも出来ぬ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「無駄なことよ。アリバイがあろうとなかろうと、妾たちの存在を否定することなど出来ぬわ。……金蔵は窓より逃れ、今や六軒島の霞よ。決して捕らえることも、否定することも出来ぬ」
Russian (RU): "Только зря время тратит. Алиби не помогут ей опровергнуть наше существование. ......Кинзо ушёл через окно и слился с туманом Роккенджимы. Едва ли она сможет найти или стереть его."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É inútil. Tendo álibis ou não, ela não pode negar nossa existência. ......O Kinzo escapou pela janela e agora está envolto pela névoa de Rokkenjima. Ela nunca vai capturá‐lo ou negá‐lo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「她是在白費工夫。不管有沒有不在場證明，都無法否定掉我們的存在。……金藏從窗戶逃走，現已是六軒島的霧霞。絕對抓不到，絕對否定不了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「她是在白费工夫。不管有没有不在场证明，都无法否定掉我们的存在。……金藏从窗户逃走，现已是六轩岛的雾霞。绝对抓不到，绝对否定不了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "È inutile. Che gli alibi esistano o meno, lei non può negare la nostra esistenza. ... Kinzo è scappato dalla finestra e ora è tutt'uno con la nebbia di Rokkenjima. Certamente non riuscirà a catturarlo o negarlo."

Speaker: Gaap
Steam (ST): "When all's said and done, perhaps you could say he's escaped to the underside of the chessboard."
Umineko Project (UP): "When all's said and done, perhaps you could say he's escaped to the underside of the chessboard."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「差し詰め、チェス盤の裏側にでも逃げ込んだ、とでも言えばいいのかしら。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「差し詰め、チェス盤の裏側にでも逃げ込んだ、とでも言えばいいのかしら」
Russian (RU): "Когда всё уже сказано и сделано, можно заявить, что он ушёл под шахматную доску."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Com tudo dito e feito, você até poderia dizer que ele escapou para a parte debaixo do tabuleiro."

Speaker: Ronove
Steam (ST): "In that case, maybe it would be appropriate to say he's been stowed away."
Umineko Project (UP): "In that case, maybe it would be appropriate to say he's been stored away."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "In that case, maybe it would be appropriate to say he's been stowed away."
PC Japanese (JP): 「その場合は仕舞い込んだ、というのが適当でしょうな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「その場合は仕舞い込んだ、というのが適当でしょうな」
Russian (RU): "Тогда было бы уместнее сказать, что его скрыли."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Nesse caso, seria mais apropriado dizer que ele foi guardado."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這種情況，還是說成“收好了”，會比較恰當吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这种情况，还是说成“收好了”，会比较恰当吧？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "In quel caso, forse sarebbe appropriato dire che è stato messo via."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "...Come to think of it, about those corpses from the first twilight... They've been stowed away too, right?"
Umineko Project (UP): "......Come to think of it, about those corpses from the first twilight. They've been stored away too, right?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Come to think of it, about those corpses from the first twilight. They've been stowed away too, right?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……そう言えば、例の第一の晩の死体。同じく仕舞い込んだのであったな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……そう言えば、例の第一の晩の死体。同じく仕舞い込んだのであったな」
Russian (RU): "......Кстати, о тех трупах с первых сумерек. Они ведь тоже скрыты?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Pensando nisso, em relação aos cadáveres do primeiro crepúsculo. Eles também foram guardados, né?"

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Ora che ci penso, riguardo a quei corpi dal primo crepuscolo. Anche loro sono stati messi via, giusto?"

Speaker: Gaap
Steam (ST): "Yes. They've been put away in my darkness, which lies between this world and the next."
Umineko Project (UP): "Yes. They've been put away in my darkness between the human world and the other."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Yes. They've been put away in my darkness between this world and the next."
PC Japanese (JP): 「えぇ。異界と人間界の狭間の、私の暗黒に仕舞ってあるわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「えぇ。異界と人間界の狭間の、私の暗黒に仕舞ってあるわ」
Russian (RU): "Да. Они попали в мою тьму между этим миром и потусторонним."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim. Eles foram postos de lado na minha escuridão, entre o mundo humano e o outro mundo."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「嗯。我把它们收入了位于异界与人界的夹缝的我之黑暗。」

Umineko Project (UP): "......And that would‐be detective won't be able to find them...?"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......E seria em um lugar onde aquela metida a detetive não será capaz de encontrar...?"

Umineko Project (UP): "Of course. It's absolutely impossible for a {y:0:Human}{n:0:human}. .........Want to check?"

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 邀貝阿朵他們去了藏屍體的異界夾縫……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 邀贝阿朵他们去了藏尸体的异界夹缝……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Invitò Beato e Ronove allo spazio tra mondi dove aveva nascosto i corpi...

Steam (ST): ...That place...was nowhere in this world... and existed at no time of this world.
Umineko Project (UP): ......That place was nowhere in this world, and existed at no time of this world.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......That place...was nowhere in this world and existed at no time of this world.
PC Japanese (JP): ……そこは、この世の如何なる場所でもなく、同時に、この世の如何なる時間でもない。
Russian (RU): ......Это место... было не в этом мире и существовало вне его времени.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Um local que não existe em lugar nenhum deste mundo, que existe à parte do tempo deste mundo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……此地既不屬於此世的任何場所，同時，也不屬於此世的任何時間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……此地既不属于此世的任何场所，同时，也不属于此世的任何时间。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Quel luogo... non era da nessuna parte in questo mondo e non esisteva in nessun tempo di questo mondo.

Steam (ST): In other words, it truly and literally was a place not of this world.
Umineko Project (UP): In other words, it truly and literally was a place not of this world.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In other words, it truly and literally was a place not of this world.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、文字通り、この世ならざる場所に違いなかった。
Russian (RU): Оно в самом истинном смысле не принадлежало этому миру.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em outras palavras, um local genuinamente e literalmente fora deste mundo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，它無疑是字面意思的，非此世之所。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，它无疑是字面意思的，非此世之所。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In altre parole, era veramente e letteralmente un luogo non di questo mondo.

Steam (ST): In this place, questions such as "Where is this?" and "What time is it?" have no meaning.
Umineko Project (UP): In this place, questions such as "Where is this?" and "What time is it?" had no meaning.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In this place, questions such as 'Where is this?' and 'What time is it?' have no meaning.
PC Japanese (JP): ここでは、ここが何処か、今が何時かを問うことには、何の意味もない。
Russian (RU): Здесь ничего не значат вопросы 'где мы?' и 'сколько времени?'.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Neste local, questões como "Onde é isso?" e "Que horas são?" não detém de significado algum.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在此地，詢問“這裡是哪裡”、“現在是幾點”，沒有任何的意義。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在此地，询问“这里是哪里”、“现在是几点”，没有任何的意义。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In questo luogo, le domande come ‘Dov'è questo posto?’ e ‘Che ora è?’ non avevano significato.

Steam (ST): Every single place led to here, but no place could be reached from here.
Umineko Project (UP): Every single place led to here, but no place could be reached from here.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Every single place led to here, but no place could be reached from here.
PC Japanese (JP): ここへは如何なる場所からも通じるが、ここからは如何なる場所にも通じない。
Russian (RU): Все дороги ведут сюда, но попасть отсюда никуда нельзя.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Todo e qualquer lugar leva a lá, mas nenhum lugar pode ser alcançado a partir daqui.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然任何地方都可通向此處，但此處卻不通向任何地方。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然任何地方都可通向此处，但此处却不通向任何地方。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ogni singolo luogo conduceva a questo posto, ma nessun luogo poteva essere raggiunto da qui.

Steam (ST): Furthermore, all times connected to this place, but no time could be passed to from here.
Umineko Project (UP): Furthermore, all times connected to this place, but no time could be passed to from here.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Furthermore, all times connected to this place, but no time could be passed to from here.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、如何なる時間からも連なるが、ここからは如何なる時間にも経過しない。
Russian (RU): Кроме того, всё время связано с этим местом, однако оно существует вне времени.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ademais, todos os tempos conectam a este lugar, mas tempo algum pode passar daqui.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 其次，雖然任何時間皆與此處相連，但在此處時間不會有任何的推移。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 其次，虽然任何时间皆与此处相连，但在此处时间不会有任何的推移。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Inoltre, tutti i tempi conducevano a questo posto, ma nessun tempo poteva essere passato da qui.

Steam (ST): In short, ...this place was just what they said it was: the underside of the chessboard.
Umineko Project (UP): In short, ......this place was just what they said it was: the underside of the chessboard.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In short, ......this place was just what they said it was: the underside of the chessboard.
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、……ここは彼らが語る通り、チェス盤の裏側。
Russian (RU): В общем...... это место есть то, о чём они сказали: обратная сторона шахматной доски.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em suma, ......este lugar é exatamente o que eles disseram ser: a parte debaixo do tabuleiro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 總而言之，……此地即是他們所言的，棋盤的另一側。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 总而言之，……此地即是他们所言的，棋盘的另一侧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In breve... questo posto era solo quello che dicevano che fosse: la parte inferiore della scacchiera.

Steam (ST): No, perhaps it would be most appropriate to call this the captured pile, where pieces that have left the game go...
Umineko Project (UP): No, perhaps it would be most appropriate to call this the captured pile, where pieces that have left the game go......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No, perhaps it would be most appropriate to call this the captured pile, where pieces that have left the game go......
PC Japanese (JP): いや、ゲーム盤を退いた駒たちの、駒置き場と呼ぶのが一番相応しいだろう……。
Russian (RU): Нет, пожалуй, его стоит назвать хранилищем, куда попадают покинувшие игру фигуры......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não, talvez fosse mais apropriado chamá‐lo de monte dos capturados, para onde as peças que deixaram o jogo são encaminhadas......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不，將此稱為放從棋盤上取走的棋子的放置處，才最恰當吧……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不，将此称为放从棋盘上取走的棋子的放置处，才最恰当吧……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): No, forse sarebbe più appropriato chiamare questo il mucchio catturato, dove andavano i pezzi che avevano lasciato il gioco...

Steam (ST): ...Then, through the pitch-black world, a glow like a faint spotlight shone, and five corpses came into view...
Umineko Project (UP): ......Then, deep within this pitch‐black world, five corpses came into view, illuminated by a glow like a faint spotlight......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Then, through the pitch black world, a glow like a faint spotlight shone, and five corpses came into view......
PC Japanese (JP): ……そして、漆黒の世界の向こうに、薄っすらとスポットライトのような灯りで照らされている、５人の死体が見えてくる……。
Russian (RU): ......Кромешно чёрный мир сверкнул, и в поле зрения вошли пять трупов......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Então, nas profundezas deste mundo de escuridão turmalina, cinco cadáveres surgiram na visão, iluminados pela fraca luz de um holofote......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……接著，他們從漆黑世界的彼方，看到了像是被微弱的聚光燈燈光照著的，5 人的屍體……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……接着，他们从漆黑世界的彼方，看到了像是被微弱的聚光灯灯光照着的，5 人的尸体……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Allora, attraverso il mondo completamente nero, splendette un bagliore come un debole riflettore, e si poterono vedere cinque corpi...

Steam (ST): The five pitiful corpses with their necks sliced open had been arranged neatly.
Umineko Project (UP): The five pitiful corpses with their necks sliced open had been arranged neatly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The five pitiful corpses with their necks sliced open had been arranged neatly.
PC Japanese (JP): 首元を鋭利にすっぱりと切られた気の毒な５人の死体が、規則正しく寝かされている。
Russian (RU): Пять жалких трупов с разрезанными шеями лежали в ряд.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os cinco deploráveis cadáveres, com seus pescoços fatiados, haviam sido postos de forma ordenada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 脖子被鋒利的利器切開的可怜的 5 具屍體，整然有序地躺在那裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 脖子被锋利的利器切开的可怜的 5 具尸体，整然有序地躺在那里。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I cinque corpi pietosi con le loro gole tagliate e aperte erano stati sistemati ordinatamente.

Steam (ST): Their eyelids were shut and their hands joined. Apparently, even Gaap had respect for the dead...
Umineko Project (UP): Their eyelids were shut and their hands joined.{n}Apparently, even Gaap had respect for the dead...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Their eyelids were shut and their hands joined. Apparently, even Gaap had respect for the dead...
PC Japanese (JP): 瞼は閉じられ、両手も組まれている。ガァプには、死者への礼儀もあるようだった…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 瞼は閉じられ、両手も組まれている。{n}ガァプには、死者への礼儀もあるようだった…。
Russian (RU): У них были закрыты веки и соединены руки.{n}По‐видимому, даже Гаап проявляет уважение к мёртвым...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Suas pálpebras haviam sido fechadas e suas mãos juntadas.{n}Aparentemente, até Gaap respeitava os mortos...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 眼皮被人撫下，雙手交叉於身前。{n}看來，噶普對死者亦是盡了禮儀…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 眼皮被人抚下，双手交叉于身前。{n}看来，噶普对死者亦是尽了礼仪…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Le loro palpebre erano chiuse e le loro mani unite. Apparentemente, anche Gaap aveva rispetto per i morti...

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}
Steam (ST): "Oh my. ......There are five sacrifices for the first twilight in this game? Not six?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Oh my. .........There are five sacrifices for the first twilight in this game? Not six?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「おや。………今回のゲームの第一の晩の犠牲者は５人なのですか？　６人ではなく？」
Russian (RU): "Надо же. .........В этой игре на первые сумерки пять жертв? Не шесть?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ora? .........Foram cinco sacrifícios para o primeiro crepúsculo deste jogo? Não seriam seis?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哦呀。………本次遊戲第一晚的犧牲者是 5 人嗎？不是 6 人？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哦呀。………本次游戏第一晚的牺牲者是 5 人吗？不是 6 人？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Caspita. ... In questo gioco ci sono cinque sacrifici per il primo crepuscolo? Non sei?"

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Oh, it's you, Teacher. I was worried about where you'd gone. The game has already reached the first twilight, and as you see, the first victims have appeared. ...So, it's finally time. I'm getting all excited...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Oh, it's you, Master. I was worried about where you'd gone. The game has already reached the first twilight, and as you can see, the first victims have emerged. ......Now it's time for the real show. I'm getting all excited...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Oh, it's you, Teacher. I was worried about where you'd gone. The game has already reached the first twilight, and as you see, the first victims have appeared. ......So, it's finally time. I'm getting all excited...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「おお、お師匠様ではないか。どこへ行っていたやら、心配したのだぞ。ゲームはもう、第一の晩を迎えて、ご覧の通り、最初の犠牲者が出ておるわ。……さぁいよいよだ。わくわくしてきたぞォ…！」
Russian (RU): "О, это вы, наставница. Я уж думала, куда вы подевались. Игра уже дошла до первых сумерек, и, как видите, появились первые жертвы. ......Наконец началось. Я так взволнована!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ah, é você, professora. Eu estava preocupada sobre seu paradeiro. O jogo já alcançou o primeiro crepúsculo e, como pode ver, as primeiras vítimas já emergiram. ......Agora é hora do verdadeiro show. Estou ficando muito empolgada...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哦——，這不是師傅大人嘛。不知道您去了哪，妾身好是擔心哦。遊戲已迎來了第一晚，如您所見，已出現了最初的犧牲者。……終於要動真格了。妾身都不禁心癢難耐了哦…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哦——，这不是师傅大人嘛。不知道您去了哪，妾身好是担心哦。游戏已迎来了第一晚，如您所见，已出现了最初的牺牲者。……终于要动真格了。妾身都不禁心痒难耐了哦…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Oh, sei tu, Maestra. Ero preoccupata per dove fossi andata. Il gioco ha già raggiunto il primo crepuscolo, e come vedi, le prime vittime sono apparse. ... Quindi, è finalmente ora. Sono tutta eccitata...!"

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}
Steam (ST): "I see. ......The you that is here looks to be in high spirits. I'm pleased."
Umineko Project (UP): "I see. .........The version of you that's here looks to be in high spirits. I'm pleased."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I see. .........The you that is here looks to be in high spirits. I'm pleased."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうですか。………ここのあなたは元気そうですね。何よりです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうですか。………ここのあなたは元気そうですね。何よりです」
Russian (RU): "Вот как. .........Твоя фигура всё ещё в бодром расположении духа. Я рада."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Entendo. .........A versão de você que está aqui parece ser bem alto‐astral.{n}Fico feliz em ver isso."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是嘛。………這裡的你，看起來挺精神呢。這可是比什麼都好啊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是嘛。………这里的你，看起来挺精神呢。这可是比什么都好啊。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Capisco. ... La te stessa che è qui sembra essere su di morale. Sono compiaciuta."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "?? I've got high spirits and a captivating body! Add in my charming disposition, and you've got my only strong points. Wahaha."
Umineko Project (UP): "Hm?? If you took away my high spirits, my bewitching <body>, and my pleasant disposition, I'd have nothing left! Wahaha."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "?? I've got high spirits and a captivating body! What else to like except a good disposition? Wahaha."
PC Japanese (JP): 「？？妾は元気と魅惑のボディ！　あと気立ての良さくらいしか取り得がないぞ？　わっはっは。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「？？　妾は元気と魅惑のボディ！　あと気立ての良さくらいしか取り得がないぞ？　わっはっは」
Russian (RU): "Хм? Если у меня заберут хорошее настроение, очарование, манеры, то от меня просто ничего не останется! Ва‐ха‐ха."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hm?? Se você tomar meu alto‐astral, meu corpinho sedutor e minha agradável disposição, não vai me sobrar mais nada! Wahaha."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「？？妾身也就只有，朝氣蓬勃、迷人的軀體！以及性格很好，這幾個長處吧？哇哈哈。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「？？妾身也就只有，朝气蓬勃、迷人的躯体！以及性格很好，这几个长处吧？哇哈哈。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "?? Ho il morale alto e un corpo accattivante! Cos'altro c'è da far piacere eccetto un buon carattere? Wahaha."

Steam (ST): For some reason, {f:5:Virgilia} praised Beato for being in high spirits.
Umineko Project (UP): For some reason, {f:5:Virgilia} praised Beato for her high spirits.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): For some reason, Virgilia praised Beato for her high spirits.
PC Japanese (JP): ワルギリアはなぜかベアトの元気を褒める。
Russian (RU): {f:5:Вергилия} почему‐то похвалила Беато за хорошее настроение.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por alguma razão, {f:5:Virgília} elogiou Beato por seu alto‐astral.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 瓦爾基莉亞莫名其妙地表揚起了貝阿朵的精神頭兒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 瓦尔基莉亚莫名其妙地表扬起了贝阿朵的精神头儿。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per qualche ragione, Virgilia complimentava Beato per il suo morale alto.

Steam (ST): Though Beato was taken aback at such granny-like words coming out of {f:5:Virgilia}'s mouth all of a sudden, she pounded her chest and answered.
Umineko Project (UP): Though Beato was taken aback at such granny‐like words coming out of {f:5:Virgilia}'s mouth all of a sudden, she answered while bumping a fist against her chest.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Though Beato was taken aback at such granny-like words coming out of Virgilia's mouth all of a sudden, she pounded her chest and answered.
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトは、何を急にババ臭いことを言い出すのかときょとんとしながらも、胸を叩いて応えるのだった。
Russian (RU): Хоть та и опешила, вдруг услышав от {f:5:Вергилии} слова, которые обычно сказала бы бабушка, она хлопнула себя по груди и ответила.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Embora Beato tenha sido surpreendida por tais palavras do vovô saindo da boca de {f:5:Virgilia} tão de repente, ela respondeu enquanto batia com o punho contra seu peito.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝阿朵儘管因不知道自己師傅幹嘛突然講出這樣頗有老婆婆味道的話而愣了一下，但她還是拍著胸膛給予了回答。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝阿朵尽管因不知道自己师傅干嘛突然讲出这样颇有老婆婆味道的话而愣了一下，但她还是拍着胸膛给予了回答。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche se Beato era stata presa alla sprovvista dalle parole da nonnina che uscivano dalla bocca di Virgilia all'improvviso, colpì il suo petto e rispose.

Steam (ST): {f:5:Virgilia} had been absent often during this game.
Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Virgilia} had been absent often during this game.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Virgilia had been absent often during this game.
PC Japanese (JP): 今回のゲームでのワルギリアは、席を外していることが多い。
Russian (RU): {f:5:Вергилия} часто отсутствовала во время этой игры.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {f:5:Virgilia} esteve ausente durante parte deste jogo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 本次的遊戲中，瓦爾基莉亞有很長一段時間沒在場。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 本次的游戏中，瓦尔基莉亚有很长一段时间没在场。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Virgilia era stata assente spesso durante questo gioco.

Steam (ST): She might even have been absent when Battler solved the epitaph, as well as during the uproar that followed.
Umineko Project (UP): She might even have been away from her seat when Battler solved the epitaph and during the uproar that followed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She might even have been away from her seat when Battler solved the epitaph and during the uproar that followed.
PC Japanese (JP): 戦人が碑文を解いて大騒ぎになった頃には、もう席を外していたかもしれない。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela possivelmente esteve fora de seu assento quando Battler resolveu o epitáfio e durante a confusão que se desenrolou logo depois.

Steam (ST): Apparently, she'd been absent for so many critical points... that she didn't really understand much about what had happened so far in this game...
Umineko Project (UP): Apparently, she had been absent for so many critical points...that she didn't have a very good grasp of what had happened so far in this game...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Apparently, she had been absent for so many critical points that she didn't really understand much about what had happened so far in this game...
PC Japanese (JP): 肝心なところをだいぶ欠席していたようなので、今回のゲームの展開を、あまり把握できていないようだった…。
Russian (RU): Её не было во многие критические моменты, поэтому она не многое знала о событиях этой игры...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ao que parece, ela esteve ausente durante muitas ocasiões importantes...que ela não deve sequer ter uma ideia geral do que aconteceu até então durante o jogo...

Chinese Simplified (CN): 由于她好像缺席了不少关键场面，所以对本盘游戏的进展情况，似乎不甚了解…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Apparentemente, è stata via in così tanti punti importanti che non capiva veramente molto di quello che era successo finora nel gioco...

Speaker: Gaap
Steam (ST): "Right now, five corpses have appeared. ...As you can see, their necks have been slit."
Umineko Project (UP): "For now, we've got five corpses. ......All slit through the neck, as you can see."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Right now, five corpses have appeared. ......As you can see, their necks have been slit."
PC Japanese (JP): 「今のところ、出ている死体は５人。……見ての通り、首をスッパリよ。」

Steam (ST): All five of them had had their necks sliced open by something sharp...
Umineko Project (UP): Something sharp had sliced open all five of their necks......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): All five of them had had their necks sliced open by something sharp......

Steam (ST): The wound opened wider than their mouths... and made it feel as though they'd no longer need their mouths to breathe.
Umineko Project (UP): Those gaping wounds opened wider than their mouths, ......and made it feel as though they would no longer need their mouths to breathe.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The wound opened wider than their mouths, ......and made it feel as though they would no longer need their mouths to breathe.
PC Japanese (JP): その切り口は、本当の口よりも大きく開き、……もはや、口を呼吸のために使う必要さえないと感じさせるものだった。
Russian (RU): Раны открылись глубже ртов...... и возникало такое чувство, будто им уже не нужны рты, чтобы дышать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os cortes se abriam mais do que suas bocas, ......e passava a impressão de que eles não precisariam mais delas para respirar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這道切口，恐怕是比真正的嘴巴都要張得更大，……簡直都已經讓人感到，沒必要用嘴巴呼吸了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这道切口，恐怕是比真正的嘴巴都要张得更大，……简直都已经让人感到，没必要用嘴巴呼吸了。

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}
Steam (ST): "...I see. So, {p:1:anyone looking at George, Jessica, Maria, Rosa, or Genji's corpses could confirm at a glance that they are dead}."
Umineko Project (UP): "......I see. So, {p:1:anyone looking at George, Jessica, Maria, Rosa, or Genji's corpses could confirm at a glance that they are dead}."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……なるほど。{p:1:譲治、朱志香、真里亞、楼座、源次の死体は、誰が見ても、一目で死亡が確認できる}、というわけですね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……なるほど。{p:1:譲治、朱志香、真里亞、楼座、源次の死体は、誰が見ても、一目で死亡が確認できる}、というわけですね」
Russian (RU): "......Понятно. То есть, {p:1:любой с первого взгляда на трупы Джорджа, Джессики, Марии, Розы и Генджи может подтвердить, что они мертвы}."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Entendo. Então, {p:1:qualquer um que olhasse para o cadáver de George, Jessica, Maria, Rosa ou Genji, poderia confirmar que estão mortos}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……原來如此。{p:1:讓治、朱志香、真里亞、樓座、源次的屍體，不論誰看了，都是一眼便可確認死亡}呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……原来如此。{p:1:让治、朱志香、真里亚、楼座、源次的尸体，不论谁看了，都是一眼便可确认死亡}呢。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Capisco. Quindi, {p:1:chiunque guardando i cadaveri di George, Jessica, Maria, Rosa, o Genji potrebbe confermare con uno sguardo che sono morti}."

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "Hmm? Red? Well, there's no point in me holding out against you. That's right, {p:1:at a glance, anyone could confirm that these corpses are dead, so it is absolutely impossible that they are just people playing dead}."
Umineko Project (UP): "Hmm? Red? Well, there's no point in me holding out against you. That's right, {p:1:at a glance, anyone could confirm that these corpses are dead, so it is absolutely impossible that they are just people playing dead}."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hmm? Red? Well, there's no point in me holding out against you. That's right, {p:1:At a glance, anyone could confirm that these corpses are dead, so it is absolutely impossible that they are just people playing dead.}"
PC Japanese (JP): 「うむ？　赤か？　まぁ、お師匠様にケチっても始まらぬ。そうとも、{p:1:死んだフリなど絶対にありえぬ、誰もが一目で死亡を確認できる死体であるわ。}」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「うむ？　赤か？　まぁ、お師匠様にケチっても始まらぬ。そうとも、{p:1:死んだフリなど絶対にありえぬ、誰もが一目で死亡を確認できる死体であるわ}」
Russian (RU): "Хм‐м? Красный? Впрочем, с вами нет смысла жадничать. Верно, {p:1:с первого взгляда кто угодно может подтвердить, что эти трупы мертвы, поэтому они абсолютно точно не могут притворяться мёртвыми}."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hmm? Vermelho? Bem, não tem por que eu me segurar contra você. Isso mesmo, {p:1:assim que os visse, qualquer um poderia confirmar que são cadáveres, por isso é absolutamente impossível que eles estejam se fingido de morto}."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗯？紅字？不過，跟師傅大人小氣，那就沒得說了。沒錯哦，{p:1:絕對不可能是什麼裝死，此乃人人都能一眼就確認死亡的屍體。}」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「嗯？红字？不过，跟师傅大人小气，那就没得说了。没错哦，{p:1:绝对不可能是什么装死，此乃人人都能一眼就确认死亡的尸体。}」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Hmm? Rosso? Beh, non c'è motivo per me di resisterti. È vero, {p:1:con uno sguardo, chiunque potrebbe confermare che questi corpi sono morti, quindi è assolutamente impossibile che siano solo persone che si fingono morte.}"

Speaker: Ronove

Umineko Project (UP): "Who knows. ......However, she is always thinking of Milady. She must have something in mind that will benefit Milady."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Who knows. ......However, she is always thinking of Milady. She's probably thinking of something that will benefit Milady."

Umineko Project (UP): Despite that, however, Ronove was right—{f:5:Virgilia} always thought of {f:5:Beatrice} first.

Steam (ST): A slightly displeased expression rose to Gaap's face as she saw that the corpses she'd gone to such lengths to hide had now been confirmed dead in red.
Umineko Project (UP): The way that these corpses, which Gaap had gone to all the trouble of erasing, had now been confirmed with the red made a slightly displeased expression rise to Gaap's face.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The way that these corpses, which Gaap had gone to all the trouble of erasing, had now been confirmed with the red made a slightly displeased expression rise to her face.
PC Japanese (JP): せっかくの消失死体を赤で確定されてしまい、ガァプはわずかに不満そうな表情を見せる。
Russian (RU): Когда эти трупы, которые она с таким трудом скрыла, подтвердили красным, на её лице появилась слегка недовольная гримаса.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A forma como os cadáveres, que Gaap teve todo o trabalho de apagar, foram confirmados com o vermelho fez surgir uma leve expressão de desagrado no rosto de Gaap.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 眼看著自己煞費苦心搞消失的屍體被紅字予以了確定，噶普露出了略帶不滿的表情。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 眼看着自己煞费苦心搞消失的尸体被红字予以了确定，噶普露出了略带不满的表情。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Il modo in cui quei corpi, che Gaap si è dovuta disturbare a cancellare, ora erano stati confermati con il rosso fece apparire sul suo volto un'espressione lievemente dispiaciuta.

Steam (ST): However, in the end, she remembered that she was only a guest and shrugged.
Umineko Project (UP): However, in the end she remembered that she was only a guest and shrugged.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, in the end she remembered that she was only a guest and shrugged.

Russian (RU): Но в конце концов Гаап вспомнила, что она всего лишь гостья, и пожала плечами.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, ela lembrou que era apenas uma convidada e não se importou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，她最後想到自己是客人，聳聳肩作罷了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，她最后想到自己是客人，耸耸肩作罢了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, alla fine ricordò che era solo un ospite e scrollò le spalle.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Steam (ST): "As to that, since the epitaph has already been solved, this game of mine is different from usual. I now have serving and protecting Natsuhi as my goal."
Umineko Project (UP): "Well, since the epitaph has already been solved, this game of mine is different from usual. I now have serving and protecting Natsuhi as my goal."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hmm. Since the epitaph has already been solved, this game of mine is different from usual. I now have serving and protecting Natsuhi as my goal."
PC Japanese (JP): 「うむ。今回の妾のゲームは、すでに碑文が解かれているため、普段とは変わっておる。今は夏妃に仕え、夏妃を守ることを目的にしているのだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「うむ。今回の妾のゲームは、すでに碑文が解かれているため、普段とは変わっておる。今は夏妃に仕え、夏妃を守ることを目的にしているのだ」
Russian (RU): "Хм. Раз эпитафия уже разгадана, эта игра отличается от обычной. Теперь моя цель — служить Нацухи и защищать её."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Bem, como o epitáfio já foi resolvido, meu jogo se tornou diferente do de costume. Agora eu tenho como objetivo servir e proteger Natsuhi."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗯。本次妾身的遊戲，因碑文已被解開，所以與平常不一樣。妾身現在是在侍奉夏妃，以保護夏妃為目的哦。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「嗯。本次妾身的游戏，因碑文已被解开，所以与平常不一样。妾身现在是在侍奉夏妃，以保护夏妃为目的哦。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Hmm. Dato che l'epigrafe è già stata risolta, questo mio gioco è diverso dal solito. Ora ho come obiettivo servire e proteggere Natsuhi."

Steam (ST): "............ How would concealing their corpses protect Natsuhi?"
Umineko Project (UP): "........................... How would concealing their corpses protect Natsuhi?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".................. How would concealing their corpses protect Natsuhi?"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………………………。藏起他们的尸体，是怎么保护夏妃的？」

Speaker: Gaap
Steam (ST): "...We've more or less figured out what our opponents' moves will be. This is probably a trap meant to corner Natsuhi. Most likely, they'll sort through alibis for the first twilight and find them for everyone except her."
Umineko Project (UP): "......We've more or less figured out what our opponents' moves will be. This is probably a trap made to corner Natsuhi. Most likely, they'll sort through alibis for the first twilight and find them for everyone except Natsuhi."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……向こうの手は大体読めてるの。多分これは、夏妃を追い詰めるための罠。恐らく、第一の晩のアリバイを突き詰めていくと、夏妃以外の全員にアリバイが現れるのよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……向こうの手は大体読めてるの。多分これは、夏妃を追い詰めるための罠。恐らく、第一の晩のアリバイを突き詰めていくと、夏妃以外の全員にアリバイが現れるのよ」
Russian (RU): "......Мы более‐менее поняли, что предпримут наши противники. Они хотят загнать Нацухи в ловушку. Боюсь, на время событий первых сумерек алиби окажутся у всех, кроме неё."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Nós mais ou menos já entendemos como serão os movimentos das nossas adversárias. Essa provavelmente é uma armadilha para encurralar a Natsuhi. O mais provável é que eles comecem a separar os álibis do primeiro crepúsculo e descubram que todos possuem um, menos Natsuhi."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……大致猜得到對方的手段哦。這多半是為了把夏妃逼至絕境的陷阱。恐怕，通過徹底追究第一晚的不在場證明，到最後，除夏妃外所有人都會有不在場證明喲。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……大致猜得到对方的手段哦。这多半是为了把夏妃逼至绝境的陷阱。恐怕，通过彻底追究第一晚的不在场证明，到最后，除夏妃外所有人都会有不在场证明哟。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Abbiamo capito più o meno quali saranno le mosse dei nostri avversari. Probabilmente questa è una trappola per circondare Natsuhi. Probabilmente, passeranno in rassegna gli alibi per il primo crepuscolo e li troveranno per tutti eccetto Natsuhi."

Speaker: Ronove
Steam (ST): "Last night, Natsuhi-sama was the first to leave the family conference, and then rested alone in her room. ...Unfortunately, she has no alibi whatsoever until the next morning."
Umineko Project (UP): "Last night, Natsuhi‐sama was the first to leave the family conference, and then rested alone in her room. ......Unfortunately, she has no alibi whatsoever until the next morning."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Last night, Natsuhi-sama was the first to leave the family conference, and then rested alone in her room. ......Unfortunately, she has no alibi whatsoever until the next morning."
PC Japanese (JP): 「夏妃さまは、昨夜は最初に親族会議を抜けられ、その後はお部屋でひとりでお休みでした。……お気の毒なことに、朝までアリバイがまったくありません。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「夏妃さまは、昨夜は最初に親族会議を抜けられ、その後はお部屋でひとりでお休みでした。……お気の毒なことに、朝までアリバイがまったくありません」
Russian (RU): "Прошлой ночью госпожа Нацухи первой покинула семейное собрание и отдыхала в своей комнате. ......К сожалению, до следующего утра у неё нет алиби."

Steam (ST): "We've already made Kinzo's existence impossible to deny. ...However, there is a single move remaining to our enemy that might cancel that out."

Steam (ST): "Of course. After all, Natsuhi isn't the culprit. No matter how much she's treated as the culprit, both the truth and phantoms are on our side. There's no way we'll lose. *cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Of course. After all, Natsuhi isn't the culprit. No matter how much they treat her as one, both truth and illusions are on our side. There's no way we can lose. *cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Of course. After all, Natsuhi isn't the culprit. No matter how much she's treated as the culprit, both the truth and phantoms are on our side. There's no way we'll lose. *cackle*cackle*cackle*cackle*!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「無論よ。何しろ、夏妃は犯人ではないのだからな。いくら犯人扱いしようとも、真実も幻想も我らに味方する。負ける道理などないわ。くっくくくくくっくっくっく！！」
Russian (RU): "Конечно. Ведь Нацухи не преступник. Сколько бы её ни считали виновной, и правда, и иллюзии на нашей стороне. Мы ни за что не проиграем. *хи‐хи*хи‐хи*хи‐хи*хи‐хи*!!!"

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「當然保得住。畢竟，夏妃並非犯人。不管怎麼把她推向犯人的位置，真實與幻想都是站在我們這一邊的。沒有輸的道理。呵、呵呵呵呵呵、呵、呵、呵！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「当然保得住。毕竟，夏妃并非犯人。不管怎么把她推向犯人的位置，真实与幻想都是站在我们这一边的。没有输的道理。呵、呵呵呵呵呵、呵、呵、呵！！」

Umineko Project (UP): "I hear what you're saying: you left before anyone else, returned to your room, and didn't leave that room until morning. I am simply explaining that I need you to prove that, otherwise it won't count as an alibi."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「先に抜けられて自室に戻り、朝まで部屋を出なかったというお話は賜りました。しかし、それを証明していただかないと、アリバイにはならないと申し上げてるのです」

Steam (ST): "It doesn't matter how. Objectively speaking, it'll all be fine as long as you prove it was impossible for you to commit the crime. ......Everyone else is cooperating. I want you to stop being so hostile and give me your alibi, along with proof."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「どうやってでも結構です。客観的に、あなたには犯行が不可能だったと証明してもらえれば結構なのです。………他の皆さんは協力して下さっています。夏妃さんも、そう邪険にされず、どうかアリバイとその証拠を示してもらいたいと思いまして」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Isso mesmo. A noite toda é um espaço em branco no tempo para a Natsuhi nee‐san. ......Depois que ela deixou a conferência dizendo que iria para cama, ela pode ter ido à casa de hóspedes e atacado o George e os demais..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……是喲。夏妃姐姐有著一整晚的空白時間。……搞不好是講了“先去休息了”地退出會議，然後去了賓館，殺害了讓治他們也說不定…」

Steam (ST): "Please don't be such a fool!! Why would I kill George-kun, and on top of that, my own daughter, Jessica?!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Don't be so ridiculous!! Why would I kill George‐kun, and most of all, whyever would I kill my own daughter?!!"

PC Japanese (JP): 「夏妃さんかて、疑われて面白いはずもあらへん。悔しいと思うなら、自分の潔白を証明する何かを探すのが先決とちゃうか…？」
Russian (RU): "Я понимаю, что вам не нравится быть подозреваемой, Нацухи. Если вас это расстраивает, разве найти способ доказать свою невиновность не самое главное?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu sei que você não gosta de estar sob suspeita, Natsuhi‐san. Se isso a deixa frustrada, nossa primeira prioridade não seria procurar por uma prova para provar sua própria inocência...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「夏妃姐，受懷疑麽可能是好玩的事吶。既然覺得不服氣，那不就該趕緊去找出能證明自己清白的證據才對麼…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「夏妃姐，受怀疑么可能是好玩的事呐。既然觉得不服气，那不就该赶紧去找出能证明自己清白的证据才对么…？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "So che non ti può piacere essere sospettata, Natsuhi-san. Se ti frustra, allora la tua prima priorità non dovrebbe essere cercare un modo per provare la tua innocenza...?"

Steam (ST): The relatives spoke as though they were all under equal suspicion, but the mood about the place didn't feel so peaceful.
Umineko Project (UP): The relatives spoke as though they were all under equal suspicion, but the mood about the place didn't feel so peaceful.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 親族たちは、疑われているのは全員公平だ、というような口調だが、場の雰囲気はそう和やかではない。
Russian (RU): Родственники говорили так, будто все были под одинаковым подозрением, но атмосфера в этом месте вовсе не была такой мирной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os parentes falaram como se todos estivessem sob igual suspeita, mas o clima no ambiente não parecia tão pacífico assim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 儘管親族們在講著，大家都公平地受到了懷疑，但氣氛卻並未緩和。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 尽管亲族们在讲着，大家都公平地受到了怀疑，但气氛却并未缓和。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I parenti parlarono come se fossero tutti sotto equi sospetti, ma il clima intorno al luogo non sembrava così pacifico.

Steam (ST): Erika was still in the middle of confirming all of the facts, but except for Natsuhi, who was uncooperative when it came to proving alibis, everyone else had an alibi that was reasonably credible.
Umineko Project (UP): Erika was still in the middle of confirming everything, but other than Natsuhi, who was unwilling to prove her alibi, everyone else had an alibi which was reasonably credible.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Erika was still in the middle of confirming everything, but except for Natsuhi, who was uncooperative when it came to proving alibis, everyone else had an alibi which was reasonably credible.
PC Japanese (JP): まだ、ヱリカが裏付けを取っている最中だが、アリバイ立証に消極的な夏妃を除き、それ以外の全員に、何らかの形で信頼性の低くないアリバイが存在しているのだ。
Russian (RU): Эрика ещё вела подтверждение, однако за исключением Нацухи, отказавшейся сотрудничать, когда дело дошло до подтверждения алиби, алиби у всех были достаточно надёжными.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Erika ainda estava confirmando tudo, mas, fora Natsuhi, que estava relutante em provar seu álibi, todos os outros já haviam apresentado álibis razoavelmente críveis.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然繪梨花還尚在取證中，但除去消極地對待立證不在場證明的夏妃，其餘所有人，全都有著某種形式的可信度不低的不在場證明。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然绘梨花还尚在取证中，但除去消极地对待立证不在场证明的夏妃，其余所有人，全都有着某种形式的可信度不低的不在场证明。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Erika era ancora nel mezzo di confermare tutto, ma eccetto per Natsuhi, che non collaborava quando si dovevano confermare gli alibi, tutti gli altri avevano un alibi che era razionalmente credibile.

Steam (ST): Only Natsuhi, who claimed that even being suspected was an insult, was uncooperative with Erika, and her position began to grow more and more perilous...
Umineko Project (UP): Only Natsuhi, who claimed that just being suspected was an insult, was uncooperative with Erika, and her position began to grow more and more perilous......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Only Natsuhi, who claimed that just being suspected was an insult, was uncooperative with Erika, and her position began to grow more and more perilous......
PC Japanese (JP): 夏妃ひとりが、疑われること自体が不愉快だとヱリカに非協力的で、少しずつ立場を危うくしている……。
Russian (RU): Только Нацухи, посчитавшая подозрения оскорблением, не сотрудничала с Эрикой, и её положение становилось всё более опасным......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Apenas Natsuhi, que afirmava que ser suspeita era um insulto, não estava cooperando com Erika, e sua posição começou a se tornar cada vez mais arriscada......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只有夏妃一人，在聲稱“受懷疑本身就是令人不快”地對繪梨花採取不合作態度，漸漸使立場變得岌岌可危……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只有夏妃一人，在声称“受怀疑本身就是令人不快”地对绘梨花采取不合作态度，渐渐使立场变得岌岌可危……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Solo Natsuhi, che dichiarava che solo l'essere sospettata era un insulto, non collaborava con Erika, e la sua posizione iniziò a diventare pericolosa...

Steam (ST): This parlor was no longer a place of comfort for Natsuhi. And the sound of the cup smashing had made that decisive.
Umineko Project (UP): This parlor was no longer a place of comfort for Natsuhi.{n}And the sound of the cup smashing had made that decisive.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): This parlor was no longer a place of comfort for Natsuhi. And the sound of the cup smashing had made that decisive.
PC Japanese (JP): すでに夏妃にとって客間は居心地のいいものではない。そしてそれを、カップを割る音が決定的にした。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): すでに夏妃にとって客間は居心地のいいものではない。{n}そしてそれを、カップを割る音が決定的にした。
Russian (RU): Для Нацухи гостиная уже перестала быть уютной.{n}И звук разбитой чашки это окончательно подтвердил.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A sala de visitas já não era mais um lugar confortável para Natsuhi.{n}E o som da xícara sendo quebrada explicitou isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對夏妃來說，客廳已不是個能舒舒服服地待著的地方了。{n}而茶杯碎裂之音，將此化為了決定性的事實。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对夏妃来说，客厅已不是个能舒舒服服地待着的地方了。{n}而茶杯碎裂之音，将此化为了决定性的事实。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questo salotto non era più un luogo di conforto per Natsuhi. E il suono della tazza che si rompeva lo fece diventare decisivo.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "...Th-That's ridiculous! Why must I be suspected when I've lost a daughter...?!! You're maliciously trying to make me look like the culprit just because I went to bed early last night! I cannot stand this humiliation any further...!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Th‐......this is ridiculous! Why must I be suspected when I've lost a daughter...?!! You're maliciously trying to make me look like the culprit just because I went to bed early last night! I cannot stand this humiliation any further...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Th, ......that's ridiculous! Why must I be suspected when I've lost a daughter...?!! You're maliciously trying to make me look like the culprit just because I went to bed early last night! I cannot stand this humiliation any further...!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ば、……馬鹿馬鹿しいことです！　どうして娘を失った私が疑われるのですか…！！　私が昨夜ひとりで先に休んだからと、犯人と決めつけようとする悪意ッ！　こんな屈辱には、これ以上耐えられません…！！」
Russian (RU): "Г... глупости! Почему меня подозревают, когда я потеряла дочь?!! Вы злонамеренно пытаетесь выставить меня преступницей лишь потому, что я рано легла спать прошлой ночью! Я больше не могу терпеть такое унижение!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Is‐......Isso é ridículo! Por que suspeitar de mim quando eu também perdi a minha filha...?! Você está maliciosamente tentando me fazer parecer culpada só porque eu me retirei mais cedo ontem! Não permitirei mais desta humilhação...!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「荒、……荒謬無稽！為什麼失去了女兒的我，要受到懷疑…？！！因為我昨晚一個人先去睡了，所以就惡意地硬要把我說成是犯人！我再也忍受不了，這種屈辱了…！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「荒、……荒谬无稽！为什么失去了女儿的我，要受到怀疑…？！！因为我昨晚一个人先去睡了，所以就恶意地硬要把我说成是犯人！我再也忍受不了，这种屈辱了…！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Q... Questo è ridicolo! Perché devo essere sospettata quando ho perso una figlia...?!! Stai maliziosamente cercando di farmi sembrare il colpevole solo perché sono andata a letto presto ieri notte! Non posso ulteriormente sopportare questa umiliazione...!!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Steam (ST): "Oh, so what are you going to do about it? Show us some kind of alibi that proves your innocence. As if you could!! Give me George back, murderer!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Oh, so what are you going to do about it? Show us some kind of alibi that proves your innocence. As if you could!! Give me back my George, you murderer!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Oh, so what are you going to do about it? Show us some kind of alibi that proves your innocence. As if you could!! Give me George back, murderer!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「へぇ、耐えられなきゃどうするの？　あなたの無実を証明するアリバイを何か示して見せなさいよ。そんなものないくせにッ！！　譲治を返して、この人殺しッ！！」
Russian (RU): "О, и что ты сделаешь? Предоставь нам алиби, доказывающее твою невиновность. Можно подумать, оно у тебя есть! Верни Джорджа, убийца!!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ah é, e o que pretende fazer? Mostre‐nos algum tipo de álibi que prove sua inocência. Se é que é capaz!! Devolva o meu George, sua assassina!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哦？忍受不了是要怎樣？有本事就把能證明你無辜的不在場證明拿出來瞧瞧呀。明明沒有！！把讓治還給我，你個殺人犯！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哦？忍受不了是要怎样？有本事就把能证明你无辜的不在场证明拿出来瞧瞧呀。明明没有！！把让治还给我，你个杀人犯！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Oh, quindi cosa hai intenzione di fare riguardo a quello? Mostraci una specie di alibi che prova la tua innocenza. Come se potessi!! Ridammi George, assassina!!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Steam (ST): "Stop it, Eva...! ...Natsuhi-san, you're probably a bit tired too. Same goes for us, of course. Why don't we take it easy for now...?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Give it a rest, Eva...! ......Natsuhi‐san, you're probably a little tired too. Of course, so are we. Why don't we take it easy for a bit...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Stop it, Eva...! ......Natsuhi-san, you're probably a little tired too. Of course, so are we. Why don't we take it easy for a bit...?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「よさんか、絵羽…！　……夏妃さん、あんたも少し疲れてるんや。もちろん、それはわしらもや。少し楽にせんか…？」
Russian (RU): "Прекрати, Ева!........Нацухи, вы тоже, наверное, устали. Как и мы. Почему бы нам пока не снизить обороты?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Dá um tempo, Eva...! ......Natsuhi‐san, você provavelmente também deve estar cansada. Afinal, todos estamos. Por que não relaxa um pouco...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「別這樣吶，繪羽…！……夏妃姐，你是稍微有點累了吶。當然，俺們也一樣。都稍微放鬆一下吧…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「别这样呐，绘羽…！……夏妃姐，你是稍微有点累了呐。当然，俺们也一样。都稍微放松一下吧…？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Smettila, Eva...! Natsuhi-san, anche tu sei un po' stanca. Ovviamente, lo siamo anche noi. Perché non ci calmiamo...?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "......Seriously. We're a little too high-strung."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Seriously. We're a little too high‐strung."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Seriously. We're a little too high-strung."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………だな。俺たちは少し気を張り過ぎだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………だな。俺たちは少し気を張り過ぎだ」
Russian (RU): ".........Действительно. Мы слишком накручены."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Pois é. Estamos todos muito tensionados."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………也是。我們有點太起勁了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………也是。我们有点太起劲了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Seriamente. Siamo un po' troppo nervosi."

Steam (ST): "Aunt Natsuhi, ...where are you going...?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Aunt Natsuhi...... Where are you going...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Natsuhi oba-san...... Where are you going...?"

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「夏妃伯母さん……。どこ行くんだよ…」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "Searching for alibis or the culprit would be truly laughable at this point...! When the typhoon passes and the police come, everything will be exposed to the light of day. There's no reason whatsoever for us to play at being detectives. Am I wrong, Erika-san?"
Umineko Project (UP): "This search for alibis and culprits is truly ludicrous...! When the typhoon passes and the police arrive, everything will be exposed to the light of day. There's no reason whatsoever for us to play detectives. Am I wrong, Erika‐san?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Searching for alibis or the culprit is truly laughable at this point...! When the typhoon passes and the police come, everything will be exposed to the light of day. There's no reason whatsoever for us to play detectives. Am I wrong, Erika-san?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「アリバイ探しも犯人探しも、実に滑稽です…！　台風が過ぎ、警察が来れば、全てが白日の下に晒されるのです。私たちが探偵ごっこをする理由など何もない。違いますか、ヱリカさん。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「アリバイ探しも犯人探しも、実に滑稽です…！　台風が過ぎ、警察が来れば、全てが白日の下に晒されるのです。私たちが探偵ごっこをする理由など何もない。違いますか、ヱリカさん」
Russian (RU): "Искать алиби и преступника сейчас поистине нелепо!.. Когда пройдёт тайфун и приедет полиция, всё будет выставлено на дневной свет. Нам незачем играть в детективов. Или я ошибаюсь, Эрика?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Esta busca por álibis e culpados é verdadeiramente ridícula...! Quando o tufão passar e a polícia chegar, tudo será exposto à luz do dia. Não tem motivo algum para ficarmos brincando de detetive. Estou errada, Erika‐san?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「查不在場證明找犯人，全都實在滑稽透頂…！等台風過後，警察來了，一切都會大白于天下。我們毫無理由玩什麼偵探遊戲。有錯嗎，繪梨花？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「查不在场证明找犯人，全都实在滑稽透顶…！等台风过后，警察来了，一切都会大白于天下。我们毫无理由玩什么侦探游戏。有错吗，绘梨花？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Cercare degli alibi o il colpevole è veramente ridicolo a questo punto...! Quando il tifone passerà e verrà la polizia, tutto sarà esposto alla luce del giorno. Non c'è la benché minima ragione per noi giocare al detective. Sbaglio, Erika-san?"

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Steam (ST): "Generally speaking, you're right. However, I do have the authority to do this."
Umineko Project (UP): "Generally speaking, you would be right. However, I have the authority to do this."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Generally speaking, you're right. However, I have the authority to do this."
PC Japanese (JP): 「一般論的にはそうですね。ですが、私にはそれをする権限がありますので。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「一般論的にはそうですね。ですが、私にはそれをする権限がありますので」
Russian (RU): "В общем‐то, нет. Но у меня есть такое право."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "De um ponto de vista mais amplo, você estaria certa. Contudo, eu tenho autoridade para fazer isso."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「一般來講，是這樣。但是，我有這麼做的權限。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「一般来讲，是这样。但是，我有这么做的权限。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Parlando in generale, hai ragione. Tuttavia, io ho l'autorità di farlo."

Steam (ST): Who gave her that authority? No one asked.
Umineko Project (UP): Who gave her that authority? No one asked.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 誰が許可した権限だというのか。それは誰も問わない。
Russian (RU): Кто дал ей это право? Никто не спросил.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quem te deu essa autoridade? Ninguém te perguntou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 是誰許可了這個權限呢？誰都不問這個問題。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 是谁许可了这个权限呢？谁都不问这个问题。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Chi le ha dato quell'autorità? Nessuno lo chiese.

Steam (ST): It was an authority given by words of power from a higher world, so the pieces weren't even allowed to doubt it...
Umineko Project (UP): It was an authority given by words of power from a higher world, so the pieces weren't even allowed to doubt it...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was an authority given by words of power from a higher world, so the pieces weren't even allowed to doubt it...
PC Japanese (JP): 上層の世界より、力ある言葉によって与えられた権限なのだから、駒である彼らには、疑問に思うことさえ許されない…。
Russian (RU): Это полномочие было дано властными словами из более высшего мира, и фигуры не могли даже усомниться в нём...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É uma autoridade concedida pelo poder das palavras de um plano superior, logo peças sequer possuem permissão para duvidar...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為這是通過上層世界的有力言語，所給予的權限，所以身為棋子的他們，連感到疑問的權利都沒有…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因为这是通过上层世界的有力言语，所给予的权限，所以身为棋子的他们，连感到疑问的权利都没有…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era un'autorità data da delle parole di potere di un mondo superiore, quindi alle pedine non era permesso dubitarne...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "I'm leaving. I have no intention of going along with your pointless questioning before the police come. If you suspect me, feel free to do so. I'm counting on the police to clear away that suspicion."
Umineko Project (UP): "I will take my leave. I have no intention of playing along with your pointless questioning until the police are here. If you suspect me, feel free to do so. I will leave it to the police to investigate that and clear my name."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I'm leaving. I have no intention of going along with your pointless questioning before the police come. If you suspect me, feel free to do so. I'm counting on the police to clear away that suspicion."
PC Japanese (JP): 「私は退出します。警察が来るまで、皆さんの下らない問答にも付き合うつもりはありません。私を疑うなら、どうぞご自由に。それを疑い、晴らすことも、私は警察に委ねますので。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私は退出します。警察が来るまで、皆さんの下らない問答にも付き合うつもりはありません。私を疑うなら、どうぞご自由に。それを疑い、晴らすことも、私は警察に委ねますので」
Russian (RU): "Я ухожу. До приезда полиции я не собираюсь участвовать в ваших бессмысленных допросах. Подозревайте меня сколько хотите. Надеюсь, полиция развеет эти подозрения."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Estou de saída. Não tenho a minha intenção de ficar brincando com você e seus questionamentos sem sentido até que a polícia chegue aqui. Se você suspeita de mim, sinta‐se à vontade. Eu irei deixar isto para a polícia investigar e limpar o meu nome."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我失陪了。在警察來之前，我不想陪諸位玩無聊的問答。要懷疑我的話，請自便。這事上的懷疑與昭雪，我全交給警察來辦。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我失陪了。在警察来之前，我不想陪诸位玩无聊的问答。要怀疑我的话，请自便。这事上的怀疑与昭雪，我全交给警察来办。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Me ne vado. Non ho intenzione di continuare con il tuo inutile interrogatorio prima che venga la polizia. Se mi sospetti, sii libera di farlo. Conto sulla polizia per eliminare quel sospetto."

Steam (ST): "...Natsuhi-san, it's dangerous to go alone... Perhaps it would be better if we all stayed here..."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Natsuhi‐san, it's dangerous to be alone... Perhaps it would be better if you......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Natsuhi-san, it's dangerous to be alone... Perhaps it would be better if you......"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Steam (ST): "Why not let her? This might make for some very good proof. If Natsuhi nee-san gets killed in her own room, that'll be excellent proof of her innocence."
Umineko Project (UP): "Why not let her? That might make for some excellent proof. If Natsuhi nee‐san gets murdered in her own room, that'll be excellent proof of her innocence."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Why not let her? That might make for some excellent proof. If Natsuhi nee-san gets killed in her own room, that'll be excellent proof of her innocence."
PC Japanese (JP): 「いいじゃない。それも立派な証明かもよ？　これで夏妃姉さんが自室で殺されてたりしたら、それも立派な無実の証明だわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「いいじゃない。それも立派な証明かもよ？　これで夏妃姉さんが自室で殺されてたりしたら、それも立派な無実の証明だわ」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Qual o problema? Isso pode se tornar uma excelente prova. Se a Natsuhi nee‐san for morta em seu próprio quarto, esta seria uma excelente prova para provar sua inocência."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「有什麼不好？這或許也是很棒的證明喲？要是夏妃姐姐在自己房間裡被殺的話，那也是很棒的無辜的證明。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「有什么不好？这或许也是很棒的证明哟？要是夏妃姐姐在自己房间里被杀的话，那也是很棒的无辜的证明。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "Quit it, Aneki. ......It's probably best if we all get a bit of rest. Our bodies won't last until tomorrow."
Umineko Project (UP): "Quit it, Aneki. .........It's probably best if we all get a bit of rest. Our bodies won't last until tomorrow."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Finiscila, Aneki. ... Probabilmente sarebbe meglio se noi tutti ci riposassimo un po'. I nostri corpi non dureranno fino a domani."

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "If we're going to take a break, we still mustn't let our guards down, got it...? We might not make it through the night, much less tomorrow."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「一服はしても油断はせず、にね…？　明日どころか、今夜も越せないかもしれないわよ」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): ".........Aunt Natsuhi, if you're returning to your room, make sure you lock it tight. Close the windows and shutters too, and stay safe. ...I don't want to suspect anyone. And more than that, ...I don't want there to be any more victims."
Umineko Project (UP): "............Aunt Natsuhi. If you're returning to your room, make sure you lock it tight, close the windows and shutters, and stay safe. ......I don't want to suspect anyone. And more than that, ......I don't want there to be any more victims."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............Natsuhi oba-san. If you're returning to your room, make sure you lock it tight. Close the windows and shutters too, and stay safe. ......I don't want to suspect anyone. And more than that, ......I don't want there to be any more victims."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………夏妃伯母さん。部屋へ帰るなら、しっかり施錠して、窓も鎧戸を閉めて、安全にしててくれよ。……俺は誰も疑いたくない。そしてそれ以上に、……もうこれ以上、誰にも犠牲になってほしくない。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………夏妃伯母さん。部屋へ帰るなら、しっかり施錠して、窓も鎧戸を閉めて、安全にしててくれよ。……俺は誰も疑いたくない。そしてそれ以上に、……もうこれ以上、誰にも犠牲になってほしくない」
Russian (RU): "............Тётя Нацухи. Если вы возвращаетесь в свою комнату, обязательно наглухо запритесь. Закройте окна и ставни, и берегите себя. ......Я не хочу никого подозревать. И ещё больше...... не хочу новых жертв."

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Natsuhi oba-san. Se stai per tornare alla tua stanza, assicurati di chiuderla bene. Chiudi anche le finestre e le persiane, e sta al sicuro. ... Non voglio sospettare nessuno. E soprattutto... non voglio che ci siano altre vittime."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Steam (ST): "......Thank you, Battler-kun. ......Then I'll return to my room. Gohda, you're in charge now. I know this is a horrible situation, but see to it that our guests have everything they need."

PC Japanese (JP): 「………ありがとう、戦人くん。………では、私は部屋に戻ります。郷田、後は任せますよ。お客様に、せめてこのような状況ではあっても、ご不自由をお掛けしないように。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………ありがとう、戦人くん。………では、私は部屋に戻ります。郷田、後は任せますよ。お客様に、せめてこのような状況ではあっても、ご不自由をお掛けしないように」
Russian (RU): ".........Спасибо, Баттлер. .........Что ж, я вернусь в комнату. Года, ты остаёшься за главного. Знаю, мы в ужасной ситуации, но проследи, чтобы у наших гостей было всё необходимое."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Obrigada, Battler‐kun. .........Então irei retornar para o meu quarto. Gohda, você está no comando agora. Eu sei que a situação é terrível, mas tenha certeza de não deixar faltar nada aos nossos hóspedes."

Umineko Project (UP): With everyone watching her, Natsuhi left the parlor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Steam (ST): From their faces, she could tell that they were expecting the classic mystery pattern... that "the first person to quarrel and leave the circle" would become the next victim.
Umineko Project (UP): From their faces, she could tell that they were expecting the classic mystery pattern...that the first person to quarrel and leave the circle would become the next victim.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): From their faces, she could tell that they were expecting the classic mystery pattern... that 'the first person to quarrel and leave the circle' would become the next victim.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼らの眼差しが、“最初に不和を持ち出し、輪を抜ける者”が、次の犠牲者になるというミステリーのお約束を期待したものであることを、知りながら。
Russian (RU): По их лицам она поняла, что они ожидают происходящего в классических детективах... 'Первый, кто рассорится с остальными и покинет круг', становится следующей жертвой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dado suas expressões, poderia se dizer que todos esperavam pelo clássico padrão das histórias de mistério...onde a primeira pessoa a discutir e deixar o círculo acaba sendo a próxima vítima.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 心知肚明著，他們的眼神是在期待“第一個鬧內訌，離開集體之人”將是下一位犧牲者的推理劇老套路。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 心知肚明着，他们的眼神是在期待“第一个闹内讧，离开集体之人”将是下一位牺牲者的推理剧老套路。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dai loro volti, lei avrebbe potuto dire che si aspettavano il classico modello giallo... che ‘la prima persona a litigare e lasciare il gruppo’ sarebbe diventata la prossima vittima.

Steam (ST): .........Natsuhi...couldn't disobey because of the threat against Krauss, who had been taken hostage.
Umineko Project (UP): ............Natsuhi......couldn't disobey because of the threat against Krauss, who had been taken as a hostage.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …………夏妃には、……蔵臼を人質に捕られ、逆らうことの出来ない脅迫がある。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ............Natsuhi......não podia desobedecer as ordens porque Krauss havia sido pego como refém, ela foi ameaçada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …………夏妃背負著一個，……因有藏臼當人質而無法違抗的脅迫。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …………夏妃背负着一个，……因有藏臼当人质而无法违抗的胁迫。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Very soon, it would be that promised time, 1:00 PM.

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Molto presto, sarà l'ora promessa, le 13:00.

Steam (ST): She was to hide for an hour in the closet of a specific guest room.
Umineko Project (UP): She was to hide for an hour in the closet of a specific guest room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She was to hide for an hour in the closet of a specific guest room.

Steam (ST): It was easy to suspect that this bizarre order was a trap to select her as the next sacrifice.
Umineko Project (UP): It was easy to suspect that this bizarre order was a trap to select her as the next sacrifice.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was easy to suspect that this bizarre order was a trap to select her as the next sacrifice.

Steam (ST): She thought of various ways to resist, but all methods would be useless against a culprit who had a hostage and was observing her from close by...
Umineko Project (UP): She thought of various ways to resist, but all methods would be useless against a culprit who had a hostage and was observing her from close by...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She thought of various ways to resist, but all methods would be useless against a culprit who had a hostage and was observing her from close by...
PC Japanese (JP): 何とか抗いたいと、様々な思考を巡らせたが、人質を取られ、身近で監視しているらしい犯人の前では、どんな手立ても無意味だった…。
Russian (RU): Она обдумывала различные методы сопротивления, но все они не сработают на преступнике, у которого есть заложник и который следит за каждым её шагом...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela pensou em várias formas de tentar resistir, mas todos os métodos seriam inúteis contra um culpado que possuía um refém e a observava de perto...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖為設法反抗，左思右想過各種對策，但在手上有人質，並且還在附近監視著自己的犯人面前，任何手段都是毫無意義的…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽为设法反抗，左思右想过各种对策，但在手上有人质，并且还在附近监视着自己的犯人面前，任何手段都是毫无意义的…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Pensò a vari modi per resistere, ma sarebbero stati tutti inutili contro un colpevole che aveva un ostaggio e la stava osservando da vicino...

Steam (ST): So Natsuhi could do nothing but obediently follow that order... and then claim that she'd been forced to do this for her husband's safety...
Umineko Project (UP): So Natsuhi could do nothing but obediently follow his orders, and then claim that she had been forced to do this for her husband's safety...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So Natsuhi could do nothing but obediently follow that order and then claim that she had been forced to do this for her husband's safety...
PC Japanese (JP): だからせめて夏妃は、その命令に素直に従うことで、夫の安全と、そして何より、自分はそれに従わされている被害者であることを、主張するしかない…。
Russian (RU): Поэтому Нацухи оставалось только послушно подчиниться этому приказу, убедив себя, что ей нужно сделать так ради безопасности мужа...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, Natsuhi não podia fazer nada além de seguir as ordens obedientemente, e depois dizer que ela foi forçada a fazer isso para garantir a segurança de seu marido...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，夏妃只好至少去通過老老實實地服從命令，來保證丈夫的安全，以及最最重要的，主張自己只是服從了這個命令的被害者…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，夏妃只好至少去通过老老实实地服从命令，来保证丈夫的安全，以及最最重要的，主张自己只是服从了这个命令的被害者…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quindi Natsuhi non poté fare nulla se non seguire obbedientemente quell'ordine e dopo affermare che era stata costretta a farlo per la sicurezza di suo marito...

Steam (ST): When the promised time had drawn near, Natsuhi had intentionally acted annoyed and smashed the cup on the ground to give her an excuse for slipping out of the parlor.
Umineko Project (UP): As the arranged time had drawn near, Natsuhi had intentionally acted annoyed and smashed the cup on the ground to give her an excuse for slipping out of the parlor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When the promised time had drawn near, Natsuhi had intentionally acted annoyed and smashed the cup on the ground to give her an excuse for slipping out of the parlor.
PC Japanese (JP): 約束の時間が近付いたので、客間を抜け出す口実を作るために、夏妃はわざと気分を害したフリをし、カップを床に叩き付けたのだった。
Russian (RU): Когда обещанное время приблизилось, Нацухи преднамеренно разозлилась и разбила чашку об пол, чтобы найти оправдание для ухода из гостиной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Conforme a hora combinada se aproximava, Natsuhi atuou intencionalmente de forma irritada, jogando sua xícara de chá no chão e dando uma desculpa para deixar a sala de visitas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因臨近說好的時間，所以為了製造離開客廳的藉口，夏妃故意裝出壞了心情的樣子，將茶杯摔到了地板上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因临近说好的时间，所以为了制造离开客厅的借口，夏妃故意装出坏了心情的样子，将茶杯摔到了地板上。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando l'ora promessa si era avvicinata, Natsuhi fece l'irritata intenzionalmente e ruppe la tazza sul pavimento per darle una scusa per scappare dal salotto.

Steam (ST): ......At any rate, no matter how cowardly a trap it may be, ...I cannot disobey now.
Umineko Project (UP): .........At any rate, no matter how cowardly a trap it may be, ......I cannot disobey now.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........At any rate, no matter how cowardly a trap it may be......I cannot disobey now.
PC Japanese (JP): ………とにかく、どんな卑劣な罠であろうとも、……今は逆らえない。
Russian (RU): .........Насколько бы трусливая ловушка меня ни ждала...... я не могу ослушаться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........A essa altura, não importa o quão covarde possa ser a armadilha, ......eu não posso desobedecer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………總之，不論那是多麼卑劣的圈套，……當前都無法抗命。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………总之，不论那是多么卑劣的圈套，……当前都无法抗命。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... In ogni caso, non importa quanto una trappola possa essere da codardi... non posso disobbedire ora.

Steam (ST): I am now the one who carries the burden of the One-Winged Eagle.
Umineko Project (UP): I am now the one who carries the burden of the One‐winged Eagle.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I am now the one who carries the burden of the One-winged Eagle.
PC Japanese (JP): 私は今や、片翼の鷲を背負う者。
Russian (RU): Теперь я несу бремя однокрылого орла.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu sou agora aquela que carrega o peso da Águia de Uma Asa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我現已是，背負片翼之鷲之人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我现已是，背负片翼之鹫之人。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sono io ora colei che trasporta il peso dell'Aquila Monoalata.

Steam (ST): ...Now that my husband, Krauss, has been captured, I must protect it even if I have to crawl through the mud...
Umineko Project (UP): ......Now that my husband, Krauss, has been captured, I must protect it even if I have to crawl through the mud...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Now that my husband, Krauss, has been captured, I must protect that even if I need to eat dirt...
PC Japanese (JP): ……夫、蔵臼が捕らわれの身である以上、私がどのような泥を啜ってでも、それを守らねばならないのだ…。
Russian (RU): ......Сейчас, когда мой муж похищен, я должна защитить его даже если придётся валяться в грязи...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Agora que o meu marido, Krauss, foi capturado, eu devo proteger isto mesmo que seja necessário rastejar na lama...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……既然我的夫君藏臼被人抓走了，那無論要吮吸怎樣的泥水，都必須由我來將此守住…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……既然我的夫君藏臼被人抓走了，那无论要吮吸怎样的泥水，都必须由我来将此守住…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ora che mio marito, Krauss, è stato catturato, devo proteggerlo anche se dovessi incassare degli insulti...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi

Chinese Simplified (CN): [=JPC]

Umineko Project (UP): ......Of course, I am prepared to do that. I am Ushiromiya Natsuhi.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……無論、その覚悟は出来ています。私は右代宮夏妃。
Russian (RU): ......Разумеется, я готова. Я — Уширомия Нацухи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......É claro, eu estou preparada para isso. Eu sou Ushiromiya Natsuhi.

Steam (ST): Even if I am not permitted to bear the One-Winged Eagle on my clothes, ......Father gave me permission to bear it in my heart...
Umineko Project (UP): Even if I am not permitted to bear the One‐winged Eagle on my clothes, .........Father gave me permission to bear it in my heart......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even if I am not permitted to bear the One-winged Eagle on my clothes, .........Father gave me permission to bear it in my heart......
PC Japanese (JP): この服に片翼の鷲を刻むことは許されていなくても、………お父様に、心に刻むことは許されたのですから……。
Russian (RU): Даже если мне нельзя носить однокрылого орла на одежде......... отец позволил мне выгравировать его на сердце......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Embora eu não tenha permissão para estampar a Águia de Uma Asa em minhas roupas, .........o pai me deu permissão para gravá‐la em meu coração......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖沒有在衣服上紋上片翼之鷲的資格，………但爸允許我將它銘刻於心……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽没有在衣服上纹上片翼之鹫的资格，………但爸允许我将它铭刻于心……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Anche se non mi è permesso di portare l'Aquila Monoalata sui miei vestiti... Nostro Padre mi ha dato il permesso di portarla nel mio cuore...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Russian (RU): [=OG]
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
